derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tūnscipe 'the inhabitants of a village' (see town, -ship)

entry.tran: (过去南非的)黑人城镇，黑人居住区
entry.def: In South Africa, a township was a town where only black people lived.

entry.tran: 区，镇区(美国及加拿大县的下一级行政区)
entry.def: In the United States and Canada, a township is an area of land, especially a part of a county which is organized as a unit of local government.

means.word_mean: 1. an administrative division of a county;

sentences.sentence: "the town is responsible for snow removal"
